description.narrative:
Under the Project( Beyond the barriers. Promotion of a gender sensitive and sustainable rural development to ensure the food security and resilience of vulnerable communities of the West Bank ) there is a need to have additional human resources in order to implement three main sub-activities, specifically requiring the skills of a field worker, an expert in national advocacy and with close relations with PA/local institutions as well as with communities in Area C. It was agreed to use the discretionary funds that is allocated this year to the EJ program to bring advocacy capacity under PLDC to deliver these AICS components. This would be for a period of three months.
Under activity 4.1 (Training on advocacy, community networking, power analysis and use of media for communities and their organization), PLDC staff will be responsible to conduct several field visits to the targeted location in five governorate in the West Bank to introduce the advocacy activities and to search for potential community mobilizer that will be potential participants for the advocacy training that will be conducted after. The training program will build capacity of communities target under R1, R2 and R3 to advocate for their own protection and livelihoods rights and needs byimproving connections between grassroots individuals and groups themselves, as well as links these groups have with policy makers crucial to their contexts. Before proceeding withthe training. PLDC will be also responsible for conducting a needs assessment to ensure that the training program is demand drivenand designed to meet real needs of target communities.
Under activity 4.2 (Local and national advocacy actions led by trained communities to improve accountability of their political representatives on issues related to sustainable livelihoods) PLDC will be responsible for the follow up on the implementation of the advocacy action plan. Implementation of the advocacy plan (4.2) means in practice to support farmers and marginalized communities inmeetings with different local/national authorities in order to advocate for specific issues which they have included in their plan.

participating-org.narrative: Registered as an NGO on 28-1-2004 under the number(NA-755-A) with the Ministry of Interior ,PLDC is a non-governmental non-for profit organization, working in rural development with a special focus on the development of the livestock small ruminant (goats and sheep) sector in the Palestinian West Bank. It has been doing so for now more than 12 years and has acquired a strong reputation for delivering quality technical services to some 100 Bedouin and other breeder communities in the often remote areas ofthe Eastern Slopesand Southern West Bank that for an important part are situated in Area C but also in other areas where raising animals is an important economic activity. While contributing to the development of the livelihoods of breeders and women, PLDC is working in small ruminant production activities (meat and dairy especially) providing veterinary services, artificial insemination and quality fodder.PLDC is a very small organization, which has developed its technical skills in the livestock sector, and is well known for technically experienced staff in the sector. PLDC developed its technical expertise very well , and works almost all over West Bank. However, its managerial, organizational and learning process are still very simple need a lot ofwork to improve. For example, it does not havean operational manual in terms of programs, finances, or management. Established in 2004, PLDC is an organization of and for breeders. Its 450 members are breeders and form their sole constituency. The BoardofPLDC is constituted solely by breeders elected from its General Assembly. PLDC#s headquarters is located in Tubas

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
